title: Die Hard is a Movie About Building Automation Insecurity. Discuss.
snippet: In this episode of the Security Ledger Podcast (#126): Die Hard has finally been embraced as the bloody, violent, feel-good Christmas movie its always been. But the film, which turns 30 this year, is about more than the power of ordinary guys to stand up to evil. Did you know it’s also a (very) early warning about the dire insecurity of building automation systems? We speak with Ang Cui of the firm Red Balloon Security about the dire risk of cyber attacks on building automation software and company’s work to secure this often-overlooked critical infrastructure.

title: 2019 Cybersecurity Predictions

Cybersecurity practitioners continue to spend vast amounts of money to mitigate all risk to the extent that we are approaching, or even reached, the point where businesses can no longer sustain it. title: Caribou Coffee data breach affects 270 locations
snippet: The Caribou Coffee chain has reported that its point of sale system was hacked, resulting in a data breach affecting dozens of locations, primarily in Minnesota. The breach was noticed on Nov. 28, after which time Caribou Coffee hired the security firm Mandiant to investigate. Mandiant reported two days later that unauthorized persons had accessed…

title: Credential stuffing attack focuses on glasses retailer Warby Parker
snippet: Warby Parker on Thursday disclosed that roughly 198,000 of its customers may have been affected by a credential stuffing attack targeting the eyeglass retail chain. According to a company press release, an unknown cybercriminal actor has been attempting to access Warby Parker customer accounts by leveraging usernames and passwords that were previously stolen from other…

title: Cisco patches privilege escalation flaw in Adaptive Securty Appliance software
snippet: Cisco Systems this week issued an update for its Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) software, fixing a high-severity vulnerability that could allow authenticated attackers with low-level access to remotely escalate their privileges on Cisco devices with web management access enabled. Designated CVE-2018-15465, the flaw is the result of an improper validation process while using the web management interface.…

title: FBI Denies Service to 15 DDoS-for-Hire Sites, Charges Operators
snippet: The FBI has taken down several of the largest DDoS-as-a-service sites on the web.

title: Caribou Coffee, Bruegger’s Bagels Bitten by Months-Long Breach
snippet: Hackers targeted hundreds of bagel stores across the U.S. to devour customers’ credit card info.
